Hymn.English: 32 The lips of the righteous know what is acceptable, But the mouth of the wicked what is perverse.

Hymn.Arabic: شَفَتَا الصِّدِّيقِ تَعْلَمَانِ الْمَرْضِيَّ ، وَأَفْوَاهُ الْمُنَافِقِينَ تَعْلَمُ الْخَدَائِعَ
Hymn.English: 11:1 Dishonest scales are an abomination to the Lord, But a just weight is His delight.

Hymn.Arabic: مِيزَانُ الْغِشِّ رِجْسٌ عِنْدَ الرَّبِّ ، وَالْوَزْنُ الْكَافِي مَرْضَاتُهُ.
Hymn.English: 2 When pride comes, then comes shame; But with the humble is wisdom.

Hymn.Arabic: حَيْثُمَا تُوجَدُ الْكِبْرِيَاءُ فَهُنَاكَ الْهَوَانُ ، وَمَعَ الْمُتَوَاضِعِينَ الْحِكْمَةُ.
Hymn.English: 3 The integrity of the upright will guide them, But the perversity of the unfaithful will destroy them.

Hymn.Arabic: دَعَةُ الْمُسْتَقِيمِينَ تُرْشِدُهُمْ ، وَفَسَادُ الْغَادِرِينَ يُدَمِّرُهُمْ.
Hymn.English: 4 Riches do not profit in the day of wrath, But righteousness delivers from death.

Hymn.Arabic: لَا يَنْفَعُ الْغِنَى فِي يَوْمِ الْغَضَبِ ، أَمَّا الْبِرُّ فَيُنَجِي مِنَ الْمَوْتِ
Hymn.English: 5 The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way aright, But the wicked will fall by his own wickedness.

Hymn.Arabic: بِرُّ الْوَدِيعِ يُقَوِّمُ طَرِيقَهُ ، أَمَّا الْمُنَافِقُ فَيَسْقُطُ بِنِفَاقِهِ.
Hymn.English: 6 The righteousness of the upright will deliver them, But the unfaithful will be caught by their lust.

Hymn.Arabic: بِرُّ الْمُسْتَقِيمِينَ يُنْقِذُهُمْ ، أَمَّا الْغَادِرُونَ فَيُؤْخَذُونَ بِفَسَادِهِمْ
Hymn.English: 7 When a wicked man dies, his expectation will perish, And the hope of the unjust perishes.

Hymn.Arabic: إِذَا مَاتَ الْإِنْسَانُ الْمُنَافِقُ هَلَكَ مِنْهُ الرَّجَاءُ ، وَأَمَلُ الْأَثَمَةِ يَبِيدُ
Hymn.English: 8 The righteous is delivered from trouble, And it comes to the wicked instead.

Hymn.Arabic: الصِّدِّيقُ يَتَخَلَّصُ مِنَ الْضِيقِ ، وَالْمُنَافِقُ يَحْلُّ مَكَانَهُ
Hymn.English: 9 The hypocrite with his mouth destroys his neighbor, But through knowledge the righteous will be delivered.

Hymn.Arabic: بِالْفَمِ يَخْدَعُ الْمُنَافِقُ قَرِيَبَهُ ، وَبِالْمَعْرِفَةِ يَنْجُو الصَّدِّيقُونَ
Hymn.English: 10 When it goes well with the righteous, the city rejoices; And when the wicked perish, there is jubilation.

Hymn.Arabic: بِخَيْرِ الصِّدِّيقِينَ تَفْرَحُ الْمَدِينَةُ ، وَعِنْدَ هَلَاكِ الْأَشْرَارِ ابْتِهَاج.
Hymn.English: 11 By the blessing of the upright the city is exalted, But it is overthrown by the mouth of the wicked.

Hymn.Arabic: بِبَرَكَةِ الْمُسْتَقِيمِينَ يَعْلُو شَأْنُ الْمَدِينَةِ ، وَبِأَفْوَاهِ الْمُنَافِقِينَ تَنْقَلِبُ.
Hymn.English: 12 He who is devoid of wisdom despises his neighbor, But a man of understanding holds his peace.

Hymn.Arabic: الْمُحْتَقِرُ صَاحِبَهُ هُوَ نَاقِصُ الْفَهْمِ ، أَمَّا ذُو الْفِطْنَةِ فَيَسْكُتُ.
Hymn.English: 13 A talebearer reveals secrets, But he who is of a faithful spirit conceals a matter.
